subject: Harry Smith: Spring Has Sprung
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



                                                                   
      May 3, 
  2007


 
 

Hi, 
      everybody,
 
Its finally starting to 
      feel like spring in New York and on this beautiful sun-drenched morning, we had a show that 
      matched the energy of the season.
 
"Spider-Man" fans can't wait for tonight at midnight 
      when the third "Spider-Man" movie finally opens. And, to 
      celebrate, "Spider-Man" star Kirsten Dunst had a super-heroic chat with Hannah. Miss Dunst was 
      charming and personable and 
      talked to Hannah about her 
      role as Peter Parker's 
      girlfriend, Mary Jane 
      Watson.
 
Also in the studio this 
      morning was People magazine's choice for the cover of its new "100 Most Beautiful People" edition. Drew Barrymore is a great guest. She seems 
      at least as beautiful on the inside as she is on the outside. We talked 
      about her new film, "Lucky You," 
      starring Eric Bana and we also talked about her work with the United 
      Nations where she is shooting a 
      documentary about UN food programs around the world. I first 
      interviewed Drew when she 
      was seven years old when she was the kid sister in Steven 
      Spielberg's "E.T." That was 25 years ago. She's literally 
      grown up in front of us and I have to agree with People, she really is a 
      beautiful person. 
 
We had the always 
      brilliant Marcus Samuelsson cook up some 
      great spring dishes with us on the plaza and we capped the morning off with spectacular music of 
      Il Divo. Those guys know how to sing.
 
What a show! We'll have more for you tomorrow 
      as "Spider-Man" himself, Tobey Maguire, visits the studio. We'll also meet the 
      latest "Survivor" castoff 
      and go behind-the-scenes of "CSI" with actor George 
      Eads. And Dave Price will give us a preview of the world’s biggest ship -- he’ll 
      be broadcasting from the deck of Royal Caribbean's brand new 
      “Liberty of the 
      Seas.”
 
Take 
      care,
 
      
Harry SmithEarlyShow@cbs.com
